intro: Erigeron tuerckheimii, commonly known as the Tuerckheim's blueweed, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that consist of both ray and disk flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and has hairy, gray-green leaves that help reduce water loss. Its showy blue to purple flowers bloom in late spring to early summer, attracting various pollinators. Erigeron tuerckheimii is often found in desert scrub and chaparral ecosystems, where it plays a role in stabilizing soil and supporting local wildlife.
